meanings.definition: Combine again in a different way.
meanings.sent1: After the party, she recombines the leftover snacks into a new tasty treat.
meanings.sent2: The artist recombines colors to create a unique painting.
meanings.sent3: He recombines his mismatched socks into funky new pairs.
meanings.sent4: The chef recombines traditional recipes with modern twists.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle pieces recombine into a beautiful picture when put together.

meanings.definition: To mix or blend together again.
meanings.sent1: She recombines the ingredients to make a delicious smoothie.
meanings.sent2: The DJ recombines different songs to create a new mix.
meanings.sent3: The kids recombine their toys to make a giant play fort.
meanings.sent4: The scientist recombines elements to form a new compound.
meanings.sent5: The colors recombine in the sky to form a stunning sunset.

meanings.definition: To unite or join together again.
meanings.sent1: The friends recombine for a fun movie night.
meanings.sent2: The team recombines their efforts to win the game.
meanings.sent3: The broken pieces recombine to form a complete vase.
meanings.sent4: The community recombines to support each other in times of need.
meanings.sent5: The scattered group recombines to form a strong alliance.
